title: Firefox has become almost unusable-- slow to load- hangs- not responding-etc.
content:
For the last several days, Firefox has become nearly unusable. It started using an excessive number of processes. Then I started getting very frequent hanging and "Mozilla Firefox (not responding). It may freeze for several minutes, and often I have to shut down and restart my PC. It then takes much longer than usual to shut down, and after restarting, it takes several tries to get Firefox to open. A couple days ago, I updated Firefox to the new version for Windows 7 Vista, and it may have actually gotten worse.

It took me about 25 minutes to type this short description of the problem because it froze several times.
creator: wkeithmilich

title: Tabs keep rearranging themselves
content: I've never had this issue until a few days ago when there was an update but all of a sudden my tabs constantly rearrange themselves and it's driivng me insane!!! It's never done this until the recent update and I can't figure out how to make it stop! Please help!!

title: Disable Page Caching
content:
I want to disable caching because it seems to cause some webpages and plugins to malfunction, not updating until a manual refresh occurs. The usual method of editing…

browser.cache.disk.enable

browser.cache.memory.enable

browser.cache.check_doc_frequency

…does not work.

Toggle Cache plugin had no effect and threw a “cannot edit data on this page” error.

Please, help.
creator: cdstarker

title: Temporary file error
content:
For the last several updates to Firefox I receive the following NSIS Error: Error writing temporary file. Make sure your temp folder is valid. Nearly every time the update completes successfully. My disk is 90% full and perhaps that is the problem although 20 GB remain. I have run disk cleanup to remove files, especially W10 Update files. Clear Disk Info doesn't identify any problem areas (all green).

Any other likely sources of the message? Thoughts?
creator: PNSheldon

title: firefox error messages

title: gmail contacts list all sudenly shrunk in size so small it cannot be read
content:
suddenly after a firefox upgrade this afternoon, the contacts lists for gmail started to get reduced in size so small it looked like specks of dust instead of names , adresses, etc. 

another pc here which hasn't been upgraded  has no problem.   both pcs have the same 5 GMAIL acccounts,

but the secondary (also sedentary ) has not been used for 2 or 3 days. Both are laptops, with Win 11 and are upgraded as soon as they available
